Cockatoos

Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo

The iconic large white cockatoo with a big, expressive yellow crest. They are highly intelligent and are often seen in movies and television.

Origin
Australia & Oceania
Size
18-20 inches (46-51 cm). Weight: 700-950g (25-33.5 oz)
Weight
825g avg.
Noise Level
Extremely Loud. Their screech is deafening and can be heard from a great distance. They are not suitable for close neighbors.

Looking for a Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo?

See Available Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 9/10
Noise Level 7/10
Social Needs 9/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Extremely intelligent, complex, and demanding. They can be affectionate but often bond with one person and can be aggressive towards others. Require a very experienced owner.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Excellent talkers and mimics. They can learn a wide vocabulary and are very good at learning tricks and complex tasks.

Dietary Needs

Prone to obesity and fatty liver disease. A low-fat pelleted diet with plenty of fresh vegetables is essential. Limit nuts and seeds to treats.

Health & Lifespan

Can live for 60-80 years. Very prone to behavioral problems like feather plucking and screaming if not given immense amounts of attention and stimulation. Produce a lot of feather dust.

Housing Requirements

Absolutely not for apartments. Requires a very large, strong cage or aviary. Minimum 40"W x 30"D x 60"H.

Common Questions About Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo

What is the lifespan of a Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo?

The Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo typically lives for 60-80 years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo come from?

The Greater Sulphur-Crested Cockatoo is native to Australia & Oceania.

Bare-Eyed Cockatoo

Loud. While maybe not as deafening as a Moluccan, they have a very loud call and enjoy using it, especially in the morning and evening.

Citron-Crested Cockatoo

Very Loud. Possess the classic, ear-splitting cockatoo screech, especially when excited or demanding attention.
